text: welcome everyone in this video we're
going to go over a new feature in Amazon
guard Duty called guard duty extended
threat detection this new feature uses
Ai and ml to help you understand attack
sequences spanning across multiple
resources data sources time periods and
helps you identify the highest priority
threats in your Cloud environment the
extended threat detection capability
works even if you enable Amazon guard
foundational threat detection with no
additional protection plans however you
will get higher security value when you
enable guard Duty dedicated protection
plans this will help guard duty to
correlate more diverse signals across
multiple data
sources to get started if you're not
familiar G duty is a security monitoring
service that analyzes and processes
foundational data sources such as AWS
cloud trail management events VPC flow
logs from Amazon ec2 instances and DNS
logs it also processes kubernetes audit
logs RDS login activity S3 data events
EBS volumes runtime monitoring and
Lambda network activity logs it uses
threaten intelligence such as list of IP
malicious IP addresses and domains and
machine learning to identify unexpected
potentially unauthorized and malicious
activity within your AWS environment
guardi then provides you with actual
findings so you can remediate this
activity guard the extended threat
detection correlates multiple signals
over time to present a holistic view of
potential security threats this feature
introduces two new finding types one for
data compromise and another for
credential compromise what sets extended
threat detection apart is its ability to
one rapidly identify complex attack
sequences spanning multiple resources
data sources and time periods two it
automatically correlates disparate
signals to provide high confidence
insights and potentially compromise
resources three to reduce the time and
effort required for security teams to
triage events importantly the attack
sequence findings are classified as
critical severity indicating high
confidence threats that require
immediate attention this prioritization
helps security teams focus on the most
urgent issues
first additionally extended threat
detection delivers minor attack mappings
for each finding these mappings provide
a standardized framework for
understanding the tactics and techniques
used in the attack sequence enabling
more comprehensive threat analysis to
further assist security teams this
feature also provides prescriptive
remediation recommendations based on AWS
best practices this guidance helps
streamline the response process and
ensures that teams are following
industry-leading security protocols now
that we have an understanding this
feature let's jump into the console and
look at one of these new findings and
dig into the
details now we're in the guard Duty
console you can see that I've navigated
to findings in the left navigation Pane
and I've already filtered by threat type
attack sequence findings only we can
look at all findings or we can specify
we only want to look at attack sequence
findings only you can see that we have a
finding for a potential data compromise
of one or more S3 buckets involving a
sequence of actions over multiple
signals associated with a user in your
account the severity is critical like we
said these attack sequence finding
severities are critical there's three
resources involved and four signals
which we'll dive into in a moment if we
click on this if we're familiar with
guard Duty you know that we can get
overview information on the right side
of the screen such as the details associ
iated with a finding or this attack
sequence finding the actors involved in
some of the other details associated
with the finding for this we're going to
go ahead and click on view details and
dive in to the
details so if we look first we can see
that the overview information has a lot
more detail and that there are it's
telling us that there are four signals
indicating a possible data compromise of
one or more S3 buckets we could see the
assumed role that this was part of in
the principal ID we can see the time
frame that this activity occurred we
know it's telling us that there are four
minor attack tactics observed
exfiltration impact Discovery and
initial access we can see that there
were techniques such as cloud service
Discovery and data manipulation
manipulation we also see that this
activity happened from a user agent that
was associated with a CI Linux user
agent and there were multiple M
sensitive API
calls we can see some of the resource
information here such as finding ID in
the type region account that this
happened we can see the attack sequence
o information according to minor tactics
overall for the whole attack sequence
finding such as Discovery initial access
exfiltration and impact if we jump over
to the right side of the screen we can
see that there are the four signals
listed below here we can see the time
frames at which they happened the signal
types so we have I users malicious IP
callers the API object was invoked from
an IP address on a custom threat Intel
list and we can see there's another one
for pinest S3 C Linux so some of this
information coming or some of this
activity coming from C
Linux for each of these we can see the
tact tactics associated with them such
as initial access and Discovery we can
see indicator information such as
Discovery initial access we can see
attack actor details and endpoint
information such as the IP address
associated with this
activity if we scroll up to the top and
click on this other tab we can see the
resources associated with this attack
sequence finding such as the access key
the S3 bucket and the ec2 instance
associated with this security issue
ultimately this attack sequence finding
is gathering a number of information
from signals and resources and mapping
this to miter tactics and techniques so
that incident responders can understand
the full breadth of a security issue and
ultimately respond more efficiently and
more effectively to an overall security
issue instead of a finding by finding
basis in this video we went over a new
feature in guard Duty that helps you
understand a tax sequence quences
spanning across multiple resources data
sources time periods helps you identify
the highest priority threats in your
Cloud environments if you want to learn
